meanings.sent1: Grandpa spoke crustily when he scolded us for running indoors.
meanings.sent2: The old sailor muttered crustily as he repaired his weathered boat.
meanings.sent3: The cat meowed crustily at the closed door, demanding to be let out.
meanings.sent4: The rusty gate swung crustily in the wind, creaking with each movement.
meanings.sent5: The dry leaves crunched crustily under our feet as we walked through the forest.

meanings.definition: Covered with a hard outer layer
meanings.sent1: The crustily bread had a satisfying crunch when bitten into.
meanings.sent2: The crustily pie crust was perfectly golden and flaky.
meanings.sent3: The crustily shell of the turtle protected it from predators.
meanings.sent4: The crustily surface of the lava rock glistened in the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The crustily layer of ice on the pond cracked under the weight of the skater.

meanings.sent1: The teacher responded crustily to the student's repeated interruptions.
meanings.sent2: The shopkeeper answered crustily when asked about the price of the item.
meanings.sent3: The tired dog barked crustily at the mailman, warning him to stay away.
meanings.sent4: The old man waved his cane crustily at the noisy teenagers on the street.
meanings.sent5: The chef shouted crustily at the kitchen staff to hurry up with the orders.
